bibl.title: Robert Ross v. David M. Littlefield. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court Third Judicial District. Holding Terms at Port Townsend

body.p: District Court Third Judicial District. Holding Terms at Port Townsend
In the matter of the application } Petition of Robert Ross, for a Writ of for a Writ. Habeas Corpus
To the Hon. C.B. Darwin, Judge of the 3rd Judicial District of W.T.

The petition of Robert Ross respectfully shows: That he the said Robert Ross is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by David M. Littlefield Sheriff of Jefferson County W.T. at the County Jail, in the City of Port Townsend W.T.

That the cause or pretense of the restraint according to the best knowledge and belief of your petitioner is upon a commitment issued by William L. Chalmers Justice of the Peace in and for Port Townsend Precinct Jefferson County W.T. upon the charge of "perjury" made by James K. Kennedy prosecuting attorney for the 3rd Judicial District, and that said charge of "perjury" is unjust to your petitioner and
Territory of Washington }ss County of Jefferson

Robert Ross being duly sworn says; That he is the petitioner named in the foregoing petition: that he has heard the petition read and knows the contents thereof, and that the same is true of his own knowledge. Except as to the matters and things stated on his information and belief, and as those matters that he believes then to be true-- Robert Ross
Subscribed and Sworn before me this 25th day of September 1867
Petition of Robert Ross for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
